text: Pūjā (Devanagari: पूजा) is a prayer service ritual done by Hindus. The word puja comes from Sanskrit, and means reverence, honor and worship. A puja honours one or more deities. It also spiritually celebrates an event.James Lochtefeld, The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Hinduism, Volume 2 (New York, N.Y.: Rosen Pub. Group, 2002), pp. 529–530, It is sometimes spelled phonetically as pooja or poojah. A Puja is the most common form of worship in the Hindu religion.Axel Michaels, Hinduism: Past and Present (Princeton; Oxford: Princeton University Press, 2004), p. 241 It may honour or celebrate the presence of special guests or they're memories after they die. Puja rituals are also held by Buddhists, Jains and Sikhs. == References == Category:Hinduism
